title: Emiliano Martinez claims he surprised Unai Emery when he became Arsenal boss
text:

Emiliano Martinez claims he surprised Unai Emery when he replaced Arsene Wenger at Arsenal - and says he's finally confident of breaking into the first team.

The Argentine shot-stopper has been at the north London club since the age of 16 but has never been considered the club's No.1 in this time.

Petr Cech hung up his gloves in the summer making Martinez Arsenal's second-choice goalkeeper behind new No.1 Bernd Leno.

And the 26-year-old, who has started in the Europa League and Carabao Cup this season, is confident that more opportunities will come his way as the club compete on four fronts.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"He [Wenger] always trusted me," Martinez told Clarin, via Sport Witness.

"Beyond his departure, people stayed in the club that already knew me. When I renewed with Wenger, he told me that I was going to be the number one at Arsenal.

(Image: REUTERS)

"Unai Emery, the current coach, wanted to see me and was very surprised with me. In fact, I stayed because I knew I had real chances; otherwise, I would have gone to play somewhere else.

"London is very nice, I'm comfortable, but I'm not staying in comfort. And if I had to go somewhere else to play, I would do it."
description: Argentine shot-stopper Emiliano Martinez has been at Arsenal since he was 16 and is eyeing a place in the first team
